text: Quite a bit the further in you go. For the GBA, they all added minigames. DKC added the photo album, DKC2 added Kerozene (they just gave you a free Kremcoin on the SNES), DKC3 added the Pacifica world and the Kroctopus boss.

text: One of the downer moments of the Game Boy Color port of this game was the replacement of this song. The one they use in the GBC version is bouncy and catchy but this one was mysterious and atmospheric. More my cup of tea.

text: I've owned and beaten all three DKC games for the SNES, and yet my favorite is also Returns. You're not alone, brother.

text: You're not weird for having DKCR as your favorite. It's probably tied with the first DKC for me. It's an amazing game with some of the best level design I've ever seen in a 2D platformer. However, I still prefer DKC's soundtrack and atmosphere.

text:

author: Matt 6418

text: about time this got on the list!
author: i smeel

text: Another memorable theme from Eveline Fischer. She helped define this game's atmosphere with a more tribal sound and it's part of the reason why I actually prefer this game over its two sequels on the SNES. The fact that it's the first one I played is probably another big reason why I find this﻿ game to be the most memorable. It also has my favorite track in the series (Aquatic Ambiance). Hearing a remix of Forest Frenzy in DKCR was such a nice surprise.
author: SupraDarky
